Literature Review: For millennia, agriculture has played a pivotal role in shaping the landscapes of our planet. The advent of technological advancements over the past six decades has significantly boosted agricultural productivity, yet these gains have come with substantial environmental and social costs. This literature review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of the world's arable land, focusing on its extent, agricultural practices, soil health, land degradation, greenhouse gas emissions, threats to biodiversity, and socio-economic dimensions. Additionally, it explores a potential new pathway for sustainable agriculture through the adoption of polycultures of novel perennial grain crops.
